meanings.definition: To pay tribute or show respect to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She was homaging her favorite author by writing a heartfelt letter of appreciation.
meanings.sent2: The community was homaging the fallen soldiers by placing flowers at the memorial.
meanings.sent3: The children were homaging their teacher by creating a special thank you card.
meanings.sent4: The artist was homaging the great painters of the past in her latest masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The students were homaging their principal with a surprise assembly to show their gratitude.

meanings.definition: The act of honoring or acknowledging someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The homaging of the brave firefighters was a touching moment at the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: His homaging of his mentor was evident in the heartfelt speech he gave.
meanings.sent3: The homaging of the family's pet goldfish with a tiny crown made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The homaging of the ancient traditions brought a sense of unity to the community.
meanings.sent5: The homaging of the historic event was captured in a beautiful mural on the town square.

meanings.definition: A gesture or action that demonstrates admiration or reverence.
meanings.sent1: Her gift was a homaging to her grandmother's love for gardening.
meanings.sent2: The statue in the park was a homaging to the town's founder.
meanings.sent3: The cake decorated with tiny graduation caps was a homaging to the students' hard work.
meanings.sent4: The annual award ceremony was a homaging to the employees' dedication.
meanings.sent5: The special edition stamp was a homaging to the famous poet's work.
